medical_history.chief_complaint: Lipodystrophy and metabolic abnormalities in a case of adult dermatomyositis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first presented in November 2000 at age 50 with an erythematous eruption on her face and upper trunk, which resolved with topical corticosteroids. In March 2001, she experienced recurrent skin lesions, myalgias, proximal muscle weakness, and hypophonia. In mid-2004, lipid abnormalities were noted with elevated triglycerides at 427 mg/dL, and loss of subcutaneous tissue began around the front of her left thigh without trauma. The lipoatrophy has progressed to involve both thighs.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient has a history of adult dermatomyositis, insulin resistance, and hypertriglyceridemia. Previous treatments included prednisone, which she could not fully tolerate, alongside other immunosuppressive therapies.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal history of hypertension, paternal history of diabetes, a cousin with rheumatoid arthritis, and two cousins with lupus erythematosus.
